author: Anonymous Calc
title: what is a "legal" argument
question: hello i was trying to figure out why my tests are invalid so I saw the following statement in the "Explanation of "Autotrader Reports" butt I'm not exactly sure what a legal and illegal argument is? could someone please explain? thanks!
student_answer: I think a "legal" argument, in this case, is an argument that is covered by the type statement for htdd. For example, if I defined a new data "Data1" and made it an enumeration of strings, I shouldn't pass a number through a function that consumes Data1 in the check-expect.
instructor_answer:
We were using legal and valid to mean the same thing.  But based on your question I just improved the text on the autograder.html page.
Let us know if there's anything else there that isn't sufficiently clear.
